page.title: 15Norfolk Reed Thatching
page.content: The{Norfolk Broads}are man-made, the result of{peat digging}at the edges of the main rivers. All around these Broads grow the{Norfolk reeds,}the raw material of the{Thatcher.}Nowadays, Thatching is big business with reeds even being shipped to America. {Norfolk reed thatch}is considered to be the finest of all, lasting for 50-60 years.The reed is made into bundles and secured to the roof with hazel sticks or 'sways' and iron hooks.On the ridge of the roof a double layer of thatch is used for strength.Thatch is warmer in winter and cooler in summer than most common types of roofing.Each thatcher 'signs' his work with his own particular unique pattern.
